item.title: Fresh Check Day - February 19, 2025
item.description: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Fresh Check Day is a national event held on college campuses, designed to promote mental health awareness, suicide prevention, and provide access to mental health resources through interactive booths, peer-to-peer messaging, and engaging activities, all aimed at destigmatizing conversations about mental health; it is the signature program of the Jordan Porco Foundation.

item.title: New Regulations for Methylene Chloride Use
item.description: The U. S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has issued a new rule for methylene chloride (dichloromethane or DCM), a chlorinated solvent commonly used in laboratories and shops. EHS will host information sessions in February to review the rule and assist affected groups with compliance.
item.author: Community

item.title: STS Colloquium scheduled for February 19
item.description: Join us on February 19 at 11:30am in Sage 5711 for a STS Colloquium with Kristen Reynolds: “Excavating the (hu)Man in the Machine: Speculating Beyond Today’s Engineering Imaginary”. Kristen’s research utilizes Black speculative literature and culture to interrogate how engineering imaginaries reproduce antiblackness through their coherence around Sylvia Wynter’s articulation of “Man2, overrepresented as the human.”

item.description: On February 19, 2025, the Qiskit Transpiler Service will undergo maintenance and will be unavailable from 4am - 6am ET. Please plan accordingly if your experiments use this service. Circuits executed on IBM Quantum Composer might also produce an error during this time.

item.title: AI/ML Research Reading Group Meetings to Begin January 22
item.description: The group’s goal is to read and discuss diverse research papers in the interdisciplinary areas of AI/ML/NLP, IS, and HCI. Whether you’re a novice or a seasoned researcher, all RPI members are welcome to join and contribute to our discussions, so, starting January 22, plan to join the group biweekly from 11am to 12pm on Wednesdays in Carnegie 113! Please contact Lydia Manikonda if you have questions.

item.title: Important Notice: NY Paid Prenatal Leave
item.description: Managers and supervisors are encouraged to attend a webinar on Thursday, February 20th at 11:00 am to learn about NY Paid Prenatal Leave. Under this policy, employees who are pregnant or trying to become pregnant receive an additional 20 hours of paid leave for prenatal medical care.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Listening in a Hectic World”
item.description: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Listening is a vehicle to get the information needed to accomplish work objectives. In today’s information-saturated work environment, everyone needs to be able to tune out the “noise” and tune in to what’s important. In this seminar, we explore a listening approach that balances the demands of getting the information that you need with the awareness that every interaction provides an opportunity to cement solid work relationships with others.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: In Person Workshop: Deeper Dive into the Active Learning Approaches of Jigsaw, Think/Pair/Share, and Visual Maps
item.description:
Tuesday, March 4, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - In this workshop, we will focus on the three active learning concepts of the Jigsaw activity, Think/Pair/Share and working with Visual Maps/Charts. We will spend some time on each of these three approaches, discussing the concept of each and looking at examples to help you think about how you might be able to incorporate the approach into your class as an activity. Please register
